description:
The 360 Image Viewer plugin enables you to display immersive 360Â° spherical panorama images directly within your application. It supports equirectangular images, allowing users to explore the full view by panning across the image. For mobile devices, it even allows looking around using the device's accelerometer, creating an engaging experience for your users. This plugin is based on the robust Pannellum library.

[b]Usage Features:[/b] 

- Autoload and autorotate the image for seamless experience.
- Configure autorotation speed to control the image rotation.
- Support for both static and dynamic images.
- External image source support.
- Interactive controls with zoom and fullscreen options.
- Mobile-friendly with accelerometer support for natural movement-based navigation.

[size=5][b]FAQ[/b][/size]

- [b]Can I load images dynamically?[/b]  
Yes, you can load both static and dynamic images, allowing for flexible content management.

- [b]Does it support mobile device gestures?[/b]
Yes, on mobile devices, users can look around the image using the accelerometer, providing an interactive experience.

- [b]Can I disable autorotation?[/b] 
Yes, autorotation can be disabled, or you can set the speed to your preference.

- [b]What types of images are supported?[/b]  
The plugin supports equirectangular images, which are ideal for 360Â° panoramas.

- [b]Is there a way to customize the viewer controls?[/b]
Yes, you can show or hide viewer controls such as zoom and fullscreen, tailoring the interface to your needs.

instructions: Add the plugin to your page and configure the properties to display your images.
name: 360 Image Viewer
plugin_instructions:
1. Drag the 360 Image Viewer element onto your page.

2. Configure Fields:
- Dynamic Image: Upload a 360Â° equirectangular panorama image.
- Autoload: Check if you want the image to load automatically.
- Autorotate Speed: Set rotation speed (positive for clockwise, negative for counterclockwise).
- Show Controls: Check to enable navigation controls.

That's it!
